Consolidate roads into simplified network

Source: R/osm_cleaning_functions.R
osm_consolidate.Rd

Consolidate roads into simplified network

osm_consolidate(x, segment = 500)

Arguments

x

a SF data frame of OSM linestrings with projected CRS
segment

numeric, max length of segments in metres

Value

Returns an data frame of LINESTRINGS

Details

This function simplifies a OSM road network by: 1) grouping small road segments into single names roads 2) splitting long roads into sections are defined by segment 3) Casting MULTILINESTRINGs into LINESTRING

Note: to avoid splitting short roads, roads are only split once they are 2x segment, but are then splits into lengths as defined by segment. For example a 600m road will not be split, but a 1100m road will be split into approximately 500m segments when segment = 500.

See also

Other OSM: cluster_junction(), line_segment_sf(), nn_line(), nn_point(), osm_get_junctions(), osm_main_roads()

Examples

library(sf)
osm = osm_main_roads(tc_data_osm)
x = sf::st_transform(osm, 27700)
osm_consolidated_200m = osm_consolidate(x, segment = 200)

#> Warning: repeating attributes for all sub-geometries for which they may not be constant
nrow(x)

#> [1] 125
nrow(osm_consolidated_200m) / nrow(x) # fewer lines

#> [1] 0.456
table(x$name)

#> 
#>      Alaska Street     Aquinas Street Barge House Street          Bear Lane 
#>                  1                  1                  2                  1 
#>     Belvedere Road   Blackfriars Road          Broadwall     Burrell Street 
#>                  6                  8                  1                  5 
#>        Coin Street     Colombo Street      Cornwall Road       Duchy Street 
#>                  2                  2                  5                  2 
#>       Exton Street          Hatfields      Hopton Street      Mepham Street 
#>                  1                  1                  6                  5 
#>       Paris Garden      Rennie Street      Secker Street   Southwark Street 
#>                  1                  1                  1                  5 
#>    Stamford Street   Station Approach        Tenison Way       Theed Street 
#>                  8                  5                  1                  2 
#>       Upper Ground    Waterloo Bridge     Waterloo Court      Waterloo Road 
#>                 13                  6                  1                 11 
#>  Whittlesey Street      Windmill Walk          York Road 
#>                  1                  1                 10 
table(osm_consolidated_200m$name)

#> 
#>      Alaska Street     Aquinas Street Barge House Street          Bear Lane 
#>                  1                  1                  1                  1 
#>     Belvedere Road   Blackfriars Road          Broadwall     Burrell Street 
#>                  2                  4                  1                  3 
#>        Coin Street     Colombo Street      Cornwall Road       Duchy Street 
#>                  2                  1                  1                  2 
#>       Exton Street          Hatfields      Hopton Street      Mepham Street 
#>                  1                  1                  4                  1 
#>       Paris Garden      Rennie Street      Secker Street   Southwark Street 
#>                  1                  1                  1                  1 
#>    Stamford Street   Station Approach        Tenison Way       Theed Street 
#>                  5                  1                  1                  1 
#>       Upper Ground    Waterloo Bridge     Waterloo Court      Waterloo Road 
#>                  4                  2                  1                  6 
#>  Whittlesey Street      Windmill Walk          York Road 
#>                  1                  1                  2 
plot(x$geometry, col = 1:nrow(x))

plot(osm_consolidated_200m$geometry, col = 1:nrow(osm_consolidated_200m))

summary(sf::st_length(x))

#>    Min. 1st Qu.  Median    Mean 3rd Qu.    Max. 
#>   3.305  15.983  31.259  50.765  73.663 338.175 
summary(sf::st_length(osm_consolidated_200m))

#>    Min. 1st Qu.  Median    Mean 3rd Qu.    Max. 
#>   19.86   45.04   99.97  111.33  151.15  322.69
